oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Headquarters, Department of the Gulf
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Edwards & Son, Atlanta, GA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mounted panoramic photograph, ‘Headquarters, Department of the Gulf.’ Sepia. Edwards & Son, Atlanta, GA. Photograph is 8.5 x 19.25” mounted on 11.5 x 22” board. Shows group of man, women and children posed in front of building [Leydon House] at 198 Peachtree Street, Atlanta, GA. The Department of the Gulf moved in the building in 1903; the building was razed in 1913. Many are wearing ribbons or badges. On front row, one African American (or someone dressed to look African American) with hair in scarf and wearing a sign ‘All Samee, Me Likee, CLAUBER, No Leekee.’ The extreme left and right edges are not shown in this image; the original print was too long for the scanner.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Panoramic photographs; Group portraits;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: To use photographs or to order reproductions, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8808. Please refer to Image Number if available and provide a brief description of the photograph.
